law.text: If a defendant is found guilty but mentally ill, the court may appoint at least one (1) psychologist or psychiatrist to examine, treat and report on the defendant's mental condition at the time of sentencing.
law.history: Amended 1988 Ky. Acts ch. 139, sec. 18, effective July 15, 1988. -- Created 1982 Ky. Acts ch. 113, sec. 9, effective July 15, 1982.
